comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: I get why people are ditching traditional banks these days.  They can be slow, pricey, and don't always have your best interests in mind and  cryptocurrency seems like a way better option for folks who want more control over their money.  I mainly use cryptocurrency now for daily purchases and stuff.  It's quicker, cheaper and more secure than banking with some giant corporation.  I haven't had any real issues with hackers or getting ripped off either.   Banks still have some usefulness when it comes to things like payroll or securing a loan.  But for most everyday transactions, I think cryptocurrency is the way of the future.  Its just a more streamlined, locked-down, and transparent system.  And the technology is only getting better as time passes.  I honestly believe cryptocurrency will revolutionize finance.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Not having a bank account is insane, for most people throughout the world.  Now as a financial advisor, and someone who knows the inner workings of banks very well, I can also say for the most part I absolutely don't trust them.  Now for smaller "mom and pop" type banks, or credit unions, that's a different story.  However the big behemoth types banks such as JP Morgan, Wells Fargo, Bank of America etc, I agree they are most certainly corrupt, and not worth using.  However to totally rid of banks is mostly nonsensical in most part of the earth.  How are you going to get paid by work?  How are you going to make payments to most outlets (most do not accept cryptocurrency)  Where are you going to store your traditional fiat money?  Etc etc..
